The tracks on which trains run are called rails.
Trains run on rails.
Trains run on steel rails.
A model train locomotive runs on rails.
A railroad is a track made of steel rails, laid on sleepers/ties and ballast, on which trains and railroad cars are run.
A railroad is a track made of steel rails, laid on ties (sleepers) set in ballast, on which trains and railroad cars are moved.
The train is on a rail.
A rail vehicle is a vehicle which travels on a rail.
The train runs on steel rails.
A railway is a road made of iron or steel rails, laid on sleepers (or ties) and ballast, on which trains and locomotives are run.
A railroad or railway is a means of conveyance of passengers and goods on wheeled vehicles running on rails, also known as tracks.

A rail transport system uses tracks as its guideway. The tracks usually consist of steel rails, installed on ties (sleepers) and ballast, on which the rolling stock, usually fitted with metal wheels, moves.
The train is on the rail track.
A train is a form of rail transport consisting of a series of connected vehicles that generally runs along a railroad track to transport cargo or passengers.
A railroad track or railway track is a structure consisting of two or more rails, typically anchored perpendicular to beams on sleepers.

A railroad is a track consisting of two parallel steel rails, generally anchored perpendicular to beams, called ties, or sleepers, which are laid at a regular interval on ballast, on which the rails are fixed.
The train is on a railway track.
Trains run on steel rails, which are laid on ties (sleepers) embedded in ballast.
A railroad is a system of tracks and associated equipment for rail transport of passengers and goods.
A rail track consists of two parallel steel rails, three feet apart, on which self-propelled rail vehicles known as trains move.
The model train locomotive is on a track.
The tracks of a railway or railroad, also known as the permanent way, is the structure consisting of the rails, fasteners, railroad ties and ballast, plus the underlying subgrade.
A railway is a road consisting of two parallel steel rails, generally anchored perpendicular to beams, called ties, or sleepers, which are laid in a straight line.
Trains are pulled along a track by a locomotive engine.
Rail tracks are laid on the ground, so that trains can move on them.
The model train locomotive is moving along the tracks.
A railway is a means of transport, a form of land transportation, consisting of a series of vehicles that usually runs along a rail track to transport passengers or cargo.

The track on a railway or railroad, also known as the permanent way, is the structure consisting of the rails, fasteners, railroad ties (sleepers, British English) and ballast (or slab track), plus the underlying subgrade.
The model train locomotive is moving along the track.
A model train locomotive is moving along the track.

A railroad track or railway track is a structure consisting of two parallel steel rails, anchored perpendicular to beams of timber, concrete or steel to maintain a consistent distance apart, or gauge.
A rail transport is a means of conveyance of passengers and goods by way of wheeled vehicles running on rails.
A rail transport system is a means of conveyance of passengers and goods by way of wheeled vehicles running on rails.
The vehicle drives on the railroad tracks.
The locomotive is a type of railway vehicle that provides the motive power for a train.
A model railway is a miniature representation of a railway system.
It is a model train.
The gauge of a railroad is the distance between the inner sides of the heads of the travel rails.
The rails are usually made of steel, and are attached to a foundation made of concrete or compressed earth and gravel in a bed of ballast.
Model trains are powered by alternating current (AC).
This vehicle drives on the rails.
A model train is a toy train that is a scale replica of a real train.
The rails are usually attached to wooden ties, or sleepers, on which the rails are fastened with spikes.
The rails are made of steel.
It drives on miniature rails.
